column4: guys I am on a friends laptop & he has a usb mouse. I installed it yesterday & it worked but today it isn't. I restarted the system twice but the same result. Anybody has any ideas?
is the mouse listed in the fsusb list ?
nope, it just shows 5 buses, device 1ID 0000:0000
there is also a printer involved, but that's another story altogether
can you unplug that mouse / plug it back in and get the lsusb | tail please ?
it really looks like the system isnt detecting the mouse ... and you have some serious problem with that broadcom network card ..
do you have another usb mouse you can try ?
that I know about, the broadcom network card

it really looks like a hardware issue, or something wrong in the usb automouting system.  if a reboot doesnt fix it I would lead to a hardware problem.  without getting my hands on it I can't be a lot more help.  sorry
issue solved, the other usb port seems to have an issue, taking out the printer & using that port for the mouse works
